snippet: Rebounding from Tommy John surgery in 2010, Stephen Strasburg allowed two hits and no runs in six innings as the Nationals beat the Mets, 4-0.
abstract: Washington National pitching ace Stephen Strasburg became an overnight phenomenon during his rookie season with the Nationals in 2010, but after spending almost all of last season recuperating from surgery he is effectively reintroducing himself in 2012.
lead_paragraph: Rebounding from Tommy John surgery in 2010, Stephen Strasburg allowed two hits and no runs in six innings as the Nationals beat the Mets, 4-0.

headline.seo: Coming Back Strong, Strasburg Overpowers Mets
